title: For Sale:  CZ 82.9×18mm Makarov.cerakoted in gun silver
postcontent: Czechoslovakian military. "Vz" is an abbreviation for "vzor", which translates to "model.".. Manufactured by the Czechoslovak firm Ceská zbrojovka the vz. 82 replaced the 7.62x25mm Tokarev vz. 52 pistol in Czechoslovak military service in 1983. It is a compact, double-action, semi-automatic pistol with a conventional blowback action. This type of action allows the barrel to remain solidly fixed to the frame, resulting in improved accuracy over pistols with pivoting barrels (like the U.S. M1911 series). The low bore axis of the vz. 82 provides for less muzzle rise and quicker follow-up shots.... cerakoted by G>P>I> in jax..one mag included..

title: For Sale/Trade:   S&W Smith and Wesson 629-6 .44 Magnum Performance Center 2.5 inch barrel.
postcontent: This is the ultimate in a carry .44. From packing concealed to a light backwoods hiking gun this will do anything you need a large pistol for. It is a performance center, with everything you would expect from Smith, crisp trigger, tight lock up, and reliable enough to bet your life on. This has a low profile front sight that is windage adjustable, and a fixed slot milled into the top strap for a rear sight. Ported barrel makes for a little more controllable recoil, but believe me you will be glad for a full grip on this gun. Comes with all the original packaging, presentation case, and paperwork. I have shot about 100 rounds through it, just enough to sight it in using 180 grain bullets, 240's hurt too much. I am looking to sell to fund my next gun, not sure what that is yet but needs to be less recoil and probably semi auto. That being said I may be open to trades, shoot me an offer, the worst I can say is no. Thanks for the look.

title: For Sale:  American Made AK-47 for SALE
postcontent:
AK 47 for Sale 
Rifle is in excellent condition
She has held sub 3 inch groups at 100 yards with the right ammo.
I can also confirm she can hit minute of head at 200yards pretty regular with a decent marksman, a 4x scope  and decent ammo. She feed anything I give her without a hiccup. She is sitting at approx 750  round count so her break in is complete and she has her whole service life ahead.   Rifle ergonomics enhanced with a SAW stock and SAW  grips.
She sports a quad rail  hand guard  with vertical and an upgraded compensator. She also has a TWS 1st Gen Dog leg rail with peep sight that STILL allows for Quick AK break down.  1 30  round mag  and tapsco red dot included, the sling is not included. 

She is a great rifle and a fantastic example of an AK done right, Wouldnt sell her but I have a new AK and just bought another toy so I need to make room . 

Just a thought from a Jarhead:

I love my ARs but when the SHTF I WANT an AK. 
If you ever have to use this in defense of your life, real world experience has taught me and the statistics back me up that range is not  generally the deciding  factor, neither is  accuracy as  you'll likely be bobbing and weaving as will the bad guy. Minute of man is just fine.  It comes down to speed of deployment, reliability and the ability to defeat cover.  The 7.62 x39  can engage past 300 yards  but Ill call it a 300 yard round.  That is more than generous in any likely scenario. What it does better than its contemporaries is destroy cover and run where few other systems can.  Neither the 5.56 nor the 5.45 can hope to match the original AK's ability to deny the enemy cover and that's where the fight is won.  Pick the right tool for the job. 

So here are the rules...

I got a magic number in my head a little lower than asking price. , First one to it without haggling gets it. I dont want the hassle of back and forth. Dont lowball me. Serious buyers only.

 FTF   for cash  or FFL ok , you pay shipping and taxes.
Valid Drivers License required.  By contacting me you affirm you are not a felon.

title: For Sale:  Brand New/never shot Mossberg 12G Flyway 2012
postcontent:
Description


The Mossberg 500 Pump Action Flyway Series Waterfowl is a pump-action hunting shotgun chambered in 12 gauge. The model 500 is a series of shotguns marketed as an inexpensive alternative for hunters, but the Flyway Series Waterfowl costs a little bit more than average at $485. What makes it different than the Waterfowl model is that it comes with different chokes. The Flyway uses ported chokes, so the gas pushing the pellets out will expel before the muzzle ultimately reducing the recoil. Otherwise it has a synthetic stock with a Real Tree finish. It has a vent rib barrel and fiber optic sights, which have bright colors that are easy to see. And, it has an ambidextrous safety. Mossberg recommends it for hunting waterfowl, of course.

title: For Sale:  Sabre Defence Massad Ayoob Signature Professional AR-15
postcontent:
Hello, I am selling my AR-15 to make room for an AR-10.  This is a high-end, well built gun, and has some collector's appeal as well.  It's a Sabre Defence Massad Ayoob Signature Series Professional 15.  This 5.56 rifle is equipped with a 16" vanadium barrel--same stuff Sabre uses(used) for making full auto M2 50BMG's, two stage match trigger, ergo grip, mid-length gas system, tritium night sights on the gas block and on a removable carry handle (gun is flat top), bayonet lug, forward assist, ambidextrous safety, Sabre "Gill Break" (very effective), and 6 position collapsible stock.  This is serial number 13 of a limited run of these guns (I was told a couple of thousand).

I bought this gun brand-new from an Army Ranger who won it in a competition and couldn't see a use for a 16" gun.  He kept the case and cleaning kit that came with these guns, but I am including a different case along with the 2 20 round mags and the 2 30 round mags that came with it.  I'll also throw in a pair of YHM elevated mounts and a cheapo (NCStar) 3-9 scope (with the gill break, it held zero just fine for me).

These were $2k new, and this one is in great shape.  It's nice and tight, I've only put a few hundred rounds through it, and it always functions flawlessly.  I'm looking for $1400 or best offer.  

I can ship to your ffl for $35, or I can do a local, hand-to-hand transaction as well.  Postal money order if shipped, or cash only.  If you would like to purchase this hand-to-hand, please bring your CCW so I know you're not a felon.  Check out the pics, and ask any questions.  I have more pics if needed.

Some people spell it Sabre Defense.

title: For Sale:  Paracord Survival Rifle Sling, Zombie AR15 AK47 AK74 SKS Hunting Cord Strap
postcontent:
Custom made paracord survival rifle Sling. 

I have Zombie Green, Black, Woodland camo, Olive Drab, Coyote brown, OD Green, Tan, Desert camo, pink, red, blue, pink camo, and several more colors in stock.

The Universal nylon ends will fit almost any rifle. They even work good on tactical rifles like the AK, SKS or AR. The nylon will also not scratch your gun like the steel clips will. The ends are made of 1" wide 4200lb tensile strength nylon. You could pull a truck with this stuff. I use the nylon instead of leather for the added strength and will not get brittle like leather over time. The nylon is held together with a black 1/4" chicago screw. The black finish on the screws are highly scratch resistant, seems to be a black chrome finish. Made of new USA made Mil spec government approved 550 7 strand Paracord. There is a total of about 90 feet of paracord in this sling. In an emergency you can unravel the outer 45 feet of cord and still have a useful black sling. 

The USA made paracord is manufactured to Mil-C-5040H Type III standards. This paracord has seven removable inner strands. Each of the 7 strands of 100% nylon strands are made from two-ply yarns. This is certainly not the lower quality paracord that is made from bulk fibers. Each of these 7 strands are capable of holding 50 pounds. The outer cord is made from 32 strands which are braided together and can hold 200 pounds. Add it up (50x7 + 200) and the cord can hold 550 lbs, therefore it is truly 550 paracord. 

Paracord is like duck tape and has unlimited uses only limited by your imagination. The 7 inner strands can also be removed and used for things like fishing line, or sewing thread.

I usually sell them for $50, but they are now just $25. Shipping is free. I also take Pay-pal or can meet in Louisville or Shelbyville.

FOR OTHER LENGTHS OR COLORS MESSAGE ME FOR AVALIBILITY & PRICE

Chris - REDACTED

postcontent: Here's a very, very nice Colt Bisley revolver! Chambered for the .38 WCF (.38-40), it wears a 5-1/2" barrel and is finished bright blue with color case hardened frame and hammer. LOTS of original finish remains. The bright blue finish on the barrel rates 95% with just a few minor marks. The cylinder shows a few rotation marks but still retains well over 90% original bright blue finish. There is some fine freckling on the grip straps, but again, almost all of the original blue finish remains. The case colors on the frame are very strong and rate 95%!! Good fire blue finish remains on trigger and screws. This wonderful revolver is fitted with a nice set of period carved "eagle" ivory grips with Colt medallions. To top it off, this is a Texas revolver and comes with a Colt factory letter showing it shipped to the West Texas town of El Paso back in 1907! A truly great gun!!

title: For Sale:  S&W style practice pistol (CO2)
postcontent:
I used to own a half dozen S&W automatic pistols, and bought this last year for safe indoor practice. Ergos and controls are modeled on the S&W Model 39 pistol.

This is a Daisy Powerline 93, a 1980s vintage CO2 BB pistol LNIB. I bought it online from an antique dealer and from the look of it, someone got this as a gift and never fired it. Came in the original box with papers, holster, and a 3-pack of extra magazines. Holster and mags still in unopened packaging. I have testfired it at work a few times, running 2 or 3 cartridges through it. Runs great.

The Model 93 is not only more reliable and durable than the later ambi-safety bumper chrome version, but it looks better too. All black with simulated walnut grips and single safety lever. Hammer does not cock, and mags insert on top of gun behind the barrel. This pistol has a grip safety. Each mag holds 15 BBs. A single CO2 cartridge is good for over a dozen mags before there is a noticeable decrease in power. With a fresh cartridge, the first few mags will fire BBs through both sides of a soda can. Gun is accurate, quiet, and safe for indoor or city use (with reasonable precautions). Please note that this all black pistol looks exactly like a real gun and BBs will injure animals and break windows. Not a toy. "You'll put an eye out with that thing." etc.

THIS WOULD MAKE A GREAT XMAS GIFT!!!! Christmas tree ornaments make great targets!

I am asking only $50 CASH (which is significantly less than I have into it). Comes with original box, holster, extra mags, over a thousand BBs, and 7 C02 canisters!

Will trade for .44 Special or .22 WRF (not WMR) ammo.

This is a pic of the actual gun. You will not find another like it.

title: For Sale:  AR-15 POF, VLTOR
postcontent:
I have for sale an AR-15 chambered in 5.56/.223. It has a 16 inch barrel with a carbine length gas tube. The barrel is chrome lined 1:9 twist and made with CMV. The barrel surface and rifling has also been nitrocarburized which hardens the surface and reduces corrosion to the barrel. The lower receiver is from POF Gen 3 version with the ambidextrous bolt release. One of the best lowers you can buy. It's matched with a Vltor MUR-1 upper receiver with a built in forward assist. This is probably one of the tightest receiver fit I've seen and has little to no play at all. It's dressed with a Midwest Industries 15" AR-15/M16 Gen2 SS-Series Hand guard/forearm, Magpul ACS stock, flat dark earth Ergo Grip, Magpul MBUS flip-up sights, Bushmaster stage 2 trigger w/ JP springs, Knights Armament vertical grip and a Midwest industries sling attachment end plate. Coming with the rifle is 4 GI mags with 20 rounds, single point sling, and a Liberty gun bag. 

No, I am absolutely not parting my POF lower receiver. They are hard to get your hands on and on top of that, they're expensive as hell.
